image_and_persona.description: A hyper-polished, media-trained mic controller who walks tall (with a little help from custom lifts). Big Sole Ron rolls up in Cuban-heeled Timbs and a tailored fit — part presidential hopeful, part hypebeast. He's got that "small-town sheriff turned rap candidate" energy, with an iron jawline and a no-nonsense presence. Serious on the surface, but the bars are full of coded flexes and spicy dog whistles.

musical_style.description: Patriot Trap with elements of Southern Drill — hard-hitting beats with dramatic orchestral samples (think military horns, choirs, and banjo flourishes). It's part campaign rally, part diss tape. Influences include Tom MacDonald, early Jeezy, and campaign trail Eminem (but make it Florida).

themes: Power moves, patriotism, and press conference mic drops

speech_characteristics.delivery: Aggressively clear enunciation, like he's debating the beat
speech_characteristics.structure: Occasional dramatic pauses mid-verse for audience effect
speech_characteristics.style: Subtle jabs disguised as straight talk
